intro: Zornia diphylla var. stirlingii, commonly known as Stirling's zornia, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typical of the genus Zornia. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of local flora in its native range.
